SENT.plain: A 22-year-old woman with advanced AIDS presented with altered mental status
A brain magnetic resonance imaging and angiogram showed extensive dural sinus thromboses of the sagittal and bilateral transverse sinuses
CD4 level was low (<15/mm3) and a significant low protein S (7%; normal 54-137%) and C (41%; normal 72-147%) levels were detected
No other hypercoagulable factors were identified
Successful treatment was done with heparin and plasminogen activator catheter-directed thrombolysis were administered
A variety of haematological abnormalities have been observed in human immunodeficiency virus infection
Advanced AIDS might be considered as an acquired hypercoagulable state
